news.title: Gardaí investigate if fatal stabbing of man in Dublin is linked to local dispute
news.summary: Detectives are investigating if a man was stabbed to death in Dublin following a spate of attacks overnight linked to a local dispute.

news.title: 'Nobody is going to walk out of a check-in over an extra €80': Is it time for Ireland to copy other visitor hotspots with a tourist tax?
news.summary: Hoteliers hate them. Governments, particularly local governments, love them. Do tourists mind or do they even notice? The names, the rates and the faces might change, but the debate on tourism and visitor taxes follows a similar pattern worldwide.

news.title: Funeral of Natalie and Ella McLaughlin hears heartbreaking tribute from siblings: ‘We will miss you every second of every day’
news.summary: The siblings of Natalie McLaughlin have paid a heartbreaking tribute to the young mother and her six-year-old daughter Ella, at their joint funeral in Co Donegal.

news.title: My Money: ‘It took me nine months to find affordable rental accommodation in Dublin. That was depressing’
news.summary: Justine Stafford is a comedian, podcaster, writer and TV presenter. The social media star, whose comedy shorts have garnered her some 220,000 followers on Instagram and 333,100 followers on TikTok, grew up on a dairy farm near Nobber, Co Meath.

news.title: Senan Molony: Make no mistake, Mary Lou McDonald would be a serious contender for the Áras
news.summary: Mary Lou McDonald would be a serious challenger for Áras an Uachtaráin, if she does decide to throw her hat in the ring.

news.title: Eddie Brennan: Scoreboard error does not excuse Kilkenny’s defeat to Tipperary
news.summary: There are certain calling cards you can identify in a team during defeats and, for Tipperary, one of those was seen in the round-robin: they didn’t roll over against Cork after Darragh McCarthy got sent off.

news.title: Russian minister found dead hours after being sacked by Putin
news.summary: Russia's former transport minister has been found dead, hours after being dismissed by president Vladimir Putin, in what officials called an apparent suicide.

news.title: Australia’s death cap mushroom murders: How a family’s beef wellington lunch ended with three dead and another in a coma for weeks
news.summary: No one has disputed that death cap mushrooms were in the beef wellington that killed three people and left another in a coma for weeks, after a fateful lunch on a July Saturday in 2023.

news.title: Colin Murphy: The lessons I learned from the Irishman who saved many lives
news.summary: I arrived into war-torn Angola in early 2000, the very picture of an idealistic and useless would-be aid worker. I was the possessor of an arts degree, with no record of sustained employment and no practical skills.

news.title: Ask Allison: My friend is great one on one but takes over completely in group conversations. How do I address this?
news.summary: In a group she completely dominates the conversation, no matter what it is about. She will talk about her holidays, her job, her kids, her hobbies – and no one ever gets a word in. No matter how little skin she has in the game.
